summary: This text outlines a historical timeline focusing on events and rulers from the birth of Jesus to the reign of Hadrian, spanning 708 years. Notable events include the birth of Jesus, crucifixion during Tiberius's rule, the writing of the Gospel by Matthew, the missionary activities of Peter and Mark, the executions of Peter and Paul, the fall of Jerusalem under Titus, John's exile on Patmos and his later gospel writing, and the death of Symon Cleophaeâ€™s son under Trajan, ending with Hadrian's reign.
